context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 indicates good capacity for both physical activity (golf) and focused work (Echo dev). Should leverage morning energy for development before golf.
strategic_priorities: Echo dev on project panel and database
House cleaning before Hunter returns at 10 PM
time_constraints: Must leave by 10:00 for golf warmup
Hunter home at 10 PM - house must be clean

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load Echo development in early morning when energy and focus are highest (6:00-9:30). This gives 3.5 hours of deep work before golf prep. Post-golf afternoon reserved for household tasks when energy naturally dips. Evening allows for final tidying and relaxation before Hunter arrives.
reasoning.energy_optimization: Capitalize on morning peak energy (7/10) for complex database work. Golf provides active recovery mid-day. Lower-energy tasks (meal planning, shopping) scheduled post-golf when physical tiredness won't impact quality. House cleaning split into two sessions to avoid fatigue.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Echo dev first (highest cognitive demand), 2) Golf (fixed commitment), 3) Initial house cleaning, 4) Meal planning (requires some focus), 5) Grocery shopping, 6) Final house tidying before Hunter arrives
reasoning.recovery_planning: 30-minute buffer after golf for lunch/recovery. Light dinner prep and relaxation time built in before Hunter's arrival. No high-intensity work scheduled after 6 PM to wind down properly.

narrative.summary: I've crafted your schedule around your golf commitment and Hunter's return tonight. I front-loaded your Echo development work from 6:00-9:30 AM to capture your best focus hours before golf. This gives you 3.5 solid hours for the project panel and database work. After golf, I've strategically placed your household tasks when energy naturally dips - perfect for meal planning and shopping. I split the house cleaning into two sessions: a quick tidy after golf and final touches before Hunter arrives at 10 PM.

questions.question: Would you prefer to do all the house cleaning in one block, or is splitting it into two sessions better for managing energy?
questions.context: Currently split to avoid fatigue, but could consolidate if you prefer

questions.question: Do you need any specific groceries or meals prepped for Hunter's return tonight?
questions.context: Might influence meal planning and shopping list priorities

schedule.title: Echo | Project Panel & Database Development
schedule.note: Peak morning energy for complex development work. Focus on project panel UI and database schema/queries.

schedule.title: Personal | Golf Prep & Drive to Course
schedule.note: Get ready, pack golf gear, drive to course for warmup

schedule.title: Personal | Warmup & Practice
schedule.note: Hit balls at driving range, practice putting, prepare for round

schedule.title: Personal | Golf with Jacob Smyle
schedule.note: 9 holes with Jacob. Enjoy the round and fresh air!

schedule.title: Personal | Lunch & Recovery
schedule.note: Quick lunch and rest after golf before afternoon tasks

schedule.title: Personal | House Tidying (Part 1)
schedule.note: Initial cleaning pass - focus on main living areas

schedule.title: Personal | Meal Planning
schedule.note: Plan meals for the week, create shopping list

schedule.title: Personal | Grocery Shopping
schedule.note: Shop for weekly groceries based on meal plan

schedule.title: Personal | Final House Tidying
schedule.note: Final touches before Hunter arrives - bathroom, bedroom, finishing touches

schedule.title: Personal | Evening Wind Down
schedule.note: Relax and prepare for Hunter's arrival at 10 PM

key_insights: 3.5 hours of morning deep work maximizes Echo development progress
Golf provides natural midday break and energy reset
House cleaning split into two sessions prevents fatigue
All errands completed by 5 PM leaves relaxed evening
Schedule ensures clean house well before Hunter's 10 PM arrival
